skill.name: uspto-database
skill.description: Access USPTO APIs for patent/trademark searches, examination history (PEDS), assignments, citations, office actions, TSDR, for IP analysis and prior art searches.
skill.summary: Access USPTO APIs for patent/trademark searches, examination history (PEDS), assignments, citations,...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains Python API clients for USPTO services. Network calls are limited to documented USPTO government endpoints. The scripts read USPTO_API_KEY from environment variables and make read-only queries to patent and trademark databases. No credential harvesting, obfuscation, or persistence mechanisms detected.

content.value_statement: Patent and trademark research is slow when data is spread across multiple APIs. This skill provides Python clients and examples for querying USPTO PatentSearch, PEDS examination history, and TSDR trademark data.
actual_capabilities: Search patents by keywords, inventors, assignees, or CPC codes
Get patent details by patent number with title, date, and assignee
Retrieve PEDS application data and transaction history
Analyze prosecution status with office action counts
Get trademark status, owners, and prosecution history
Check trademark health with alerts for abandoned or expired marks
limitations: Requires USPTO API key for all API calls
Dependent on USPTO API availability and rate limits (45 requests/min)
PatentSearch data through June 2025; PEDS covers 1981 to present

use_cases.title: Prior art search
use_cases.description: Find patents by keywords, assignees, and CPC codes, then review abstracts and titles.

use_cases.title: Prosecution monitoring
use_cases.description: Track PEDS transaction history and office action activity for active applications.

use_cases.title: Trademark status checks
use_cases.description: Check TSDR status, owners, and prosecution events for multiple marks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic patent lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the PatentSearch client to get patent 11234567 and list title, date, and assignee.

prompt_templates.title: Inventor search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search patents by inventor Jane Doe and return the newest 10 results with numbers and titles.

prompt_templates.title: PEDS status summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Use PEDS to summarize status, filing date, pendency days, and latest office actions for application 16123456.

prompt_templates.title: Trademark health audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Check trademark health for serial 87654321 and list any alerts with current status.

output_examples.input: Summarize the status and recent office actions for application 16123456.
output: Recent office actions: CTNF on 2024-02-10, CTFR on 2024-06-01

best_practices: Store the USPTO_API_KEY in environment variables, never in scripts
Request only needed fields to reduce response size
Add backoff handling for 429 rate limit responses
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys in scripts or prompts
Ignoring rate limits with large unthrottled loops
Assuming all fields are present in every record

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Python 3 and requires the requests library plus optional uspto-opendata-python library.

faq.question: What limits apply?
faq.answer: USPTO APIs enforce rate limits, such as 45 requests per minute for PatentSearch.

faq.question: Can I integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes, you can call the scripts from Claude, Codex, or Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: Does it access my local files or secrets?
faq.answer: It only reads the USPTO_API_KEY environment variable and sends it to USPTO APIs.

faq.question: Why do I get 401 or 429 errors?
faq.answer: Verify your API key is correct, then retry with backoff and a lower request rate.

faq.question: How does it compare to PatentsView?
faq.answer: PatentSearch replaces PatentsView with newer data and ElasticSearch query support.
